title: Advantage of Stratified Random Sample
question_text:
A local school has $2{,}000$ students enrolled and $100$ faculty members. The Vice-Principal of the school will select a sample of $210$ students and faculty members in order to gauge the opinions of both students and faculty on the quality of the food offered in the school cafeteria.
Why is it advantageous to take a stratified random sample, using students and faculty as strata, rather than a simple random sample?

choices.text: A stratified sample ensures the most random sample is taken.
A stratified sample ensures both students and faculty members are chosen to be part of the sample.
A stratified sample is the simplest and easiest way for the Vice Principal to gather opinions.
A stratified sample will ensure the quality of the food in the school cafeteria will improve.
There is no advantage in taking a stratified sample rather than a simple random sample.
